fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

We've received reports that whenever an issue is updated by an app or a user other than themselves, the web panels of apps refresh.

They've also said it doesn't happen on all instances, and I've been unable to reproduce on my test instance, which suggests that this is caused by a new feature undergoing a progressive rollout.

[https://community.developer.atlassian.com/t/web-panels-on-new-issue-view-are-reloaded-after-external-change-to-an-issue/32599]

 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open an new issue view
 # Add some apps and enable their web panels
 # Update issue as a different user in another browser session *OR* update issue programmatically via REST API or third-party app (must also be making calls as different user)

h3. Expected Results

The web panels do not refresh to their original state
h3. Actual Results

Web panels are refreshing to their original state
h3. Notes

The fact that it only happens on some instances suggests that this is caused by a new feature undergoing a rollout.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Editing issues causes addons' web panels to reload

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The (currently) native JS Function AbortController is not available for some browsers, such as IE 11, Chrome (older versions). The absence of this function causes the *Watchers Button* to not work and throws the following JS error.

{code}
vendor.bcfa11c905030ace3a1d.7.js:1 ReferenceError: AbortController is not defined
at new t (view.js:125)
at uo (vendor.bcfa11c905030ace3a1d.7.js:1)
at Es (vendor.bcfa11c905030ace3a1d.7.js:1)
at Ns (vendor.bcfa11c905030ace3a1d.7.js:1)
at Hi (vendor.bcfa11c905030ace3a1d.7.js:1)
at $i (vendor.bcfa11c905030ace3a1d.7.js:1)
at Cu (vendor.bcfa11c905030ace3a1d.7.js:1)
at Tu (vendor.bcfa11c905030ace3a1d.7.js:1)
at Mu (vendor.bcfa11c905030ace3a1d.7.js:1)
at kr (vendor.bcfa11c905030ace3a1d.7.js:1)
di @ vendor.bcfa11c905030ace3a1d.7.js:1
{code}

You can check if your browser is compatible here https://caniuse.com/#search=AbortController

h3. Steps to reproduce
(using an incompatible browser)
# Click on watchers
# Try clicking on "Add watchers"

h3. Expected Results
Nothing happens

h3. Actual Results
The user should be able to add watchers

h4. Workaround
None at the moment.

h4. Notes
There was a case of a user affected by this using Chrome recent versions, although we couldn't find the reason that AbortController was missing, we suspect this was due to configuration.

The solution will be to Polyfill the function for compatibility.
fields.summary: Some browsers may not work with the AbortController function breaking the "Add watchers" button

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

There is a new section in the new JIRA issue view that list down all issues in the same epic. It allows users track the completion of the epic and also allows  users to be able to view all these issues in the issue navigator via the 'View in search' feature. The problem with this feature is that it generates very bloated JQL if there a lot of issues in the epic.

!image-2019-10-10-17-34-07-600.png|thumbnail! 

When users attempt to export all the issues in the issue navigator, this will lead to an error due to the bloated JQL.

!image009.png|thumbnail!

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Activate new JIRA issue view.
# Create an epic issue type JIRA ticket.
# Create a lot of issues under the epic in step 2.
# There should be a long list of issues showing now for issues under the same epic. Click on 'View in search' as shown in the screenshot below.
!image-2019-10-10-17-34-07-600.png|thumbnail! 
# The issue navigator will open and you will notice a huge JQL chunk at the advance search field.
!image-2019-10-10-17-42-47-553.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
The JQL should be something simpler like '"Epic Link" = XXX-xxx'.

h3. Actual Results
Bloated JQL

h3. Workaround
No workaround for this besides using simpler JQL queries to return all issues under the epic.
fields.summary: New JIRA issue view 'View in search' feature is generating bloated JQL queries in issue navigator

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If you open saved filter and edit it you must execute a search before you can save, this is working as intended.  However there is an error occuring on the method used to trigger the search and there a difference in outcome when you trigger the search via the enter/return key or if you click the "Search" button with your mouse before you save, Noting this is a cosmetic error only but does cause confusion as to wether the save was successful not leaving behind a "Edited" identifier intended to tell the user the filter needs to be saved although it already has been saved.

h3. Environment
Jira Cloud
For Jira Server See corresponding BUG: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-70108

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open a Saved filter in the issue navigator
# edit the filter in any way
# Note that next to the JQL's title a object "Edited" appears noting a change occurred to the filter and it needs to be saved
# Click the search button with your mouse
# Click Save
# a popup noting the save was successful will appear in the upper right corner of the active browser window
# Note the "Edited" notation goes away 
# Note that the filter is saved correctly
# Make another change to the filter
# Note the "Edited" notation re-appears
# This time Hit return/enter key to trigger the search
# Select save
# a popup noting the save was successful will appear in the upper right corner of the active browser window

h3. Expected Results
It is expected that the Edited notation will go away noting the current filter displayed is correct without any pending edits needed to be saved before navigating from the page

h3. Actual Results
While the filter is correctly saved it will still display the "Edited" object causing confusion to the end user that is not sure if the filter has actually saved correctly or not
 !Screen Shot 2019-10-09 at 2.55.08 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
The "Edited" notation is class "filter-edited-object"

h3. Workaround
Using the mouse click to search before saving will make the edited notation go away to provide verification the filter was saved, BUT it is not necessarily needed as the save action is completing and and a popup will note successful as well so the edited notation is only a cosmetic error,  But just to be on the save side you can also re-open the filter in a new tab just to verify the save was successful so you do not navigate away and loose track of the filter changes.
fields.summary: Mouse Click and return/enter in JQL edit have different outcomes

fields.description: In our enterprise roll out of service desk we've run into multiple scenario's where requests have multiple sub-tasks or components that relate to the the parent task. For instance if you are moving a series of workstations. This would be easily accomplished if the requester had the ability to add sub-tasks to the the main task. The only way to make this happen is to provide access to the full Jira interface which is defeats half the reason we are looking at Jira Service Desk in the first place.
fields.summary: Subtasks for Jira Service Desk

fields.description:
As a Product Owner, I should be able to to rank an issue higher or lower independently when it is displayed on a different board rather than having the ranking reflect one global ranking.

Use Case:
 * Issues are created in a global new feature request project and all are stack ranked based on priority
 * Using the query filter of other project boards, specific epics or feature groups are filtered from that new feature request board and displayed to other project boards where they will be mixed into the work of those projects (they will usually comprise 20% of that project's work.)
 * As they are not the primary focus of the project to which they are filtered, the new feature issues would be ranked differently in that context.  While they might be the top of the New Feature request board, in a project board there might be 5 issues ahead of it that should be done first.

This happens with every project we have and at every organization where I have managed projects.
fields.summary: Allow for ranking issues in different kanban boards independently

fields.description:
h3. +Overall Goal:+
 * Increase efficiency and accuracy for users to track their time against a specific issues or projects. 
 * Increase time tracking usability when users are actively working on multiple issues or projects

h3. +Background:+
 * Time tracking has always been a challenge for users and organizations to track how much effort was actually put into a specific project or issue. In my experience, anytime a users is logging time against an issue in Jira, it is always a rough subjective estimate of how long the user was working on the issue.
 * The reality of the situation is users aren't keeping a notepad or excel sheet on how long they are working on a current issue, especially if users are switching between multiple issues to complete a certain tasks. Time tracking can get quite fuzzy when trying to accurately log time between multiple issues. 
 * For the organizations using the time tracking feature, it can be very difficult to do the following points with the current time tracking in jira v.s. a semi-automatic time tracking feature:
 ** Resource allocation and capacity planning within agile or other methodologies 
 ** Accurate time tracking against specific issue types
 ** Accurate reporting on where teams are spending a majority of their time based on the issue or task.
 ** Accurate time tracking for billable hours.
 ** Time and budget planning for current and future projects.

h3. +Current Challenges:+
 * Users not accurately tracking time against issues.
 * Logging time after the issue has been completed.
 * Unable to track or monitor what the user actually did against an issue when tracking time.
 * Users sometimes forget to track time on issues _*(Training problem, but it can be improved with a better user experience).*_
 * **Users don't like to waste time manually logging time on an issues, especially when users are juggling multiple issues 

h3. +Suggestion User Stories:+
 * As a Developer switching between multiple Jira issues, I would like to be able to start. pause, and end a timer that tracks my time against an issue, so I do not have to manually track my time each time I am switching between issues.
 * As a Project Manager, I would like to have more accurate time tracking for project issues, so I can more accurately plan and estimate the duration of a future projects with similar tasks. 
 * As a Team Manager, I would like to more accurate time tracking for my team, so I can accurately measure where my team is spending their time.
 * As a Billing Manager, I would like to have more precise time tracking feature, so I can accurately bill our customers for the work our teams have completed.

h3. +Suggested Functionality:+
 * Ability for users to start a timer on an issue.
 * Ability for users to pause a timer on an issue.
 * Ability for users to end a timer and log time against an issue.
 ** Ability for users to edit the timer duration before logging time against an issue.
 * Ability for users to cancel or reset a timer.
 * Ability for users to log internal notes or a summary of what was completed during the duration of the logged time.
 * Ability for users to configure the feature's fields based on specific user groups or issue types.
 * Ability for users to turn the feature on or off based on their preference for project, tasks, etc. 
 * Ability for users to leave the page, return to the page, and still see the unlogged paused time on the issue that still needs submitted.
 

h3. +Other Notes:+
 * I've seen other requests like this suggestion in the JRASERVER , but I was unable to find anything that fulfills this need for team-managed (formerly next-gen) besides manual time entry.
 ** JRASERVER-1946
 ** JRASERVER-14907
 * I've seen 3rd party tools that organizations can purchase and utilize in the marketplace, but they either require a purchase or it takes some manually configure the tool to work seamlessly into your reporting.
 * Time tracking has the potential to be a powerful and insightful tool if implemented correctly. I believe the community wants to have better tools to manage projects and their teams inside jira. I believe this suggestion can be very beneficial for a wide variety of users utilizing Jira as the main project management platform and for that reason, I believe this suggestion should be apart of Jira's core product.
fields.summary: [Team-managed Project] [Time Tracking] - Add functionality for users to start and stop a live timer to track/log the time worked on an issue

fields.description:
h3. Problem statement

When creating issues in Jira, there is no fucntion or field that allows you to search for tickets while creating the issues. This can cause users to create similar or duplicate issues that already exist.

h3. Proposed solution

Provide a custom field type that allows searching for issues. This fields can be then be added in the create issue screen.
fields.summary: Ability to search for issues when creating tickets

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Creating a custom field of Parent Link type does not render the custom field name at the new issue view.
It displays the field but the name is Parent Link instead of the given Custom Field name.
At the old issue view, the field is displayed with the correct custom name.
At the new issue view, at the history, the field is displayed with the correct custom name that was updated.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a custom field of Parent Link type
# Give a custom name
# Add to the screen

h3. Expected Results
The field should be displayed as the custom name of the custom field

h3. Actual Results
The field is displayed with Parent Link as its name.

h3. Workaround
Switch to the old issue view if you'd require to see the custom field name properly. At the new issue view, the field is displayed with the name Parent Link but works as expected.
fields.summary: Creating a custom field of Parent Link type does not render the custom field name at the new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The "Log Work" functionality when transitioning an issue is using the JIRA System "Default user time zone" to set the "Date Started".
 It should be using the "User Time zone" set in the Profile section
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to an issue, find a workflow transition that has log work added to the transition screen
 # Click on "Log Work" and check the Time in "Date Started"
 # Change your user timezone by going to your Profile
 # Refresh the issue
 # Click on "Log Work" and check the "Date Started" field again

h3. Expected Results

The Time defaults to the timezone recently set in the profile
h3. Actual Results

The Time remains the same as before because it still uses the JIRA "Default user time zone"
h3. Workaround

No available workaround
fields.summary: Log Work uses Default user timezone instead of User's timezone when transitioning an issue

fields.description:
h3. Problem Statement
When Sprint contains more than 5 result, the rest is hidden and " \# more options. Continue typing to refine further." is displayed.
 !Screenshot 2019-10-07 at 8.45.55 AM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggestion
Option to show more than 5 results when filtering Sprints
fields.summary: Option to show more than 5 results when filtering Sprints

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When we edit a filter through *View all filters* page, the options to share filter appears even if the user is not granted with "Share dashboards and filters" global permission in the site.
 !View all filters - Edit filter.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Revoke user's "Share dashboards and filters" global permission
# Login as this user and create a filter
# Access "View all filters" page: https://<site-name>.atlassian.net/secure/ManageFilters.jspa
# Click on three dots in front of the filter you own and select "Edit"

h3. Expected Results
Share options (Access) do not appear for this user as he/she is not granted with "Share dashboards and filters" global permission

h3. Actual Results
Share options are available:
 !View all filters - Edit filter.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
Although user is able to add project/group options, "Save" button does not take any action and the changes could not be saved. Following error appears in browser devTools panel:
{code:json}
{"errorMessages":[],"errors":{"shares":"You do not have permission to share. All shares are invalid.","shares_delegated":"The user 'John Smith' does not have permission to share. The owner has not been changed."}}
{code}
 !View all filters - Edit filter - Error.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Share filter feature appears for users with no "Share dashboards and filters" global permission

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Inconsistencies observed with doing csv imports from Issues and Filter Section vs while doing it from External System import section in Jira
h3. Steps to Reproduce

While doing a csv import from Jira settings > External System Import we can map fields like Request Type etc

 

!Screen Shot 2019-10-05 at 3.02.53 PM.png|width=407,height=133!

 

 

However while doing an import from Issue & Filters > Search > Import Issues from csv we cannot map some fields like Request Type etc:

!Screen Shot 2019-10-05 at 3.09.32 PM.png|width=645,height=183!
h3. Expected Results

 

Both the csv imports should work in thee same way
h3. Actual Results

We see inconsistencies with the imports

 

h3. Workaround

User External system import instead of Csv import from the Issues and filter section however importing files from External System import does not trigger an issue created event which is again a problem as a lot of script listeners depend on Jira to fire an issue created event.
fields.summary: All fields cannot be mapped while doing a csv import from Issues & Filters Section

fields.description: When selecting a fix release on the iOS/Mac application, either for new tickets or when updating tickets, released versions are not displayed separately from unreleased versions, making selection of the proper version difficult without full awareness of release status.
fields.summary: iOS Application - Fix Release selection

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Currently, there is no validation when a user adds an attachment to the issue.

A user can upload the very same file again, including the very same name used by an existing attachment within the issue.

h3. Suggestion

Jira should validate the file being uploaded, so no duplicates are created.
fields.summary: Jira should not accept duplicate filenames in the same issue

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
You can neither add a bullet or numbered list to a quoted text block nor select the list and convert it to quoted text in the new issue view editor.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In the new editor either try to paste a bullet list in an already created quoted text block or select an existing list and click on the  quoted text icon


h3. Expected Results
The bullet list is added to a quoted text block

h3. Actual Results
The quoted text block is added below the list:
 !cannot-quote-lists.gif! 

h3. Workaround
Use the old issue view
fields.summary: Cannot quote lists in the new issue view editor

fields.description:
h4. Summary
In the New Editor, when users type Atlassian product names, they will automatically format to the desired format.

h4. Example
JIRA or jira  > Jira
BitBucket > Bitbucket
HipChat > Hipchat

h4. Solution
Users want the ability to choose whether or not this occurs. Provide a way to disable the formatting of Atlassian products if users do not desire it.

h4. Workaround
After the text is autoformatted, ctrl+Z (Windows) or cmd+Z (macOS) will revert the change.
fields.summary: Ability to disable autocorrecting of Atlassian product names in new editor

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Markdown for inline code does not work in the new issue view.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open a ticket and click to add a description or a comment.
 # Use `sample text` to add inline code.

h3. Expected Results
I will make the text added between `` as inline code.

h3. Actual Results
The first character will be removed and the `` will not disappear.

 !Screen Recording 2019-10-04 at 11.10 AM.gif! 

h3. Workaround
Type the text and use the option for code directly in the editor.

 !Screen Recording 2019-10-03 at 04.50 PM.gif! 

Reference: [Code and Syntax Highlighting|https://github.com/adam-p/markdown-here/wiki/Markdown-Cheatsheet#code-and-syntax-highlighting]
fields.summary: Markdown for inline code does not work in the new issue view

fields.description:
There could be a way of mentioning the current assignee of an issue through a variable instead of typing the name manually.

For example, instead of typing [ ~dwoo@atlassian.com] for this feature request ticket to mention my user, we could do through @$reporter.

This could be applied for all user system fields displayed on the issue view.
fields.summary: Ability to mention through variables (assignee, reporter, etc)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Jira Webhook, returns incomplete URI for the "Issue" > "Self" payload.

h3. Environment
Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to *Jira Settings > System > WebHooks*
# Create a New Webhook
# Assign it to a Webhook receiver e.g. https://webhook.site
# Select an Issue related event to be sent out e.g. Issue: created, updated
# Save the New Webhook

h3. Expected Results
The payload received for the issue should have a "self" output with the URI as 
{code} "self": "https://<instance>.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/issue/10080" {code}

h3. Actual Results
The URI received is incomplete without the endpoint denoting its an issue, hence a 404 error will be returned, if you query the link
{code}
"self": "https://<instance>.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/10080" {code}


{code}
"issue": {
    "id": "10080",
    "self": "https://<instance>.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/10080",
    "key": "COM-9",
    "fields": {
      "statuscategorychangedate": "2019-10-04T20:18:04.523+0800",
      "customfield_10070": null,
      "customfield_10071": {
        "self": "https://<instance>.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/user?accountId=5ab5195exxxxxxxxx",
        "name": "prince.ny",
        "key": "prince.nyeche",
        "accountId": "5ab5195e0dcbxxxxxxxx",
        "emailAddress": "prince.nyeche@",
        "avatarUrls": {
          
        }
{code}


h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Webhook event for  "issue" > "Self" returns incomplete URI

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Selecting user in a user picker field through keyboard interactions throws following error:
{code}
User '<display-name>' was not found in the system.
{code}

h3. Note
This occurs in old issue view

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add a user picker field (single user) to issue screen
# Access the issue in old issue view
# Press dot key in the keyboard (*.*)
# Type and select the user picker field to be updated
# Type a user and select it using "Enter" key in the keyboard
# Click on *Submit*

Watch this video for more visibility:  [^Screen Recording 2019-10-04.mov] 

h3. Expected Results
User picker field is updated

h3. Actual Results
Following error appears:
{code}
User '<display-name>' was not found in the system.
{code}

h3. Workaround
Select the user via mouse click in step 5 (Steps to Reproduce)
fields.summary: Unable to update user picker field using keyboard interaction

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Trailing alphabets/characters in the filter name while opening them in Issue Navigator are being truncated.

Steps to Reproduce
 # Have a filter name with some trailing alphabets like "j", "g", "y", such as "Test filter - yy gg jj pp abcdef"
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
* The alphabets are displayed properly.

h3. Actual Results
* The bottom part of the alphabets are cut off.

h3. Workaround
None.
fields.summary: Filter name in issue navigator is truncating trailing alphabets like "j", "g", "y"

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
There is no option to enable receiving notifications when users to mention themselves

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow users to be able to mention themselves without needing to enable the Notification of your own changes in the Profile settings

h3. Why this is important
Tagging yourself is not a change, it is a deliberate action to tag yourself because you want to notify yourself
fields.summary: Notification for Self Mentions

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary:

Can't delete or modify conditions in workflows when Field is selected “Assignee”
h3. Environment

Jira Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Field is “Assignee”, condition is “!=“, Value is empty, comparison type is “String”. (After publishing this condition, this cannot be modified/deleted)
 # When Field is selected a value other than “Assignee”, and others as mentioned in
 point 1, after publishing the workflow we get an option to modify/delete the condition.
 # Point 1 can be modified/deleted if condition for point 1 is added after condition of
 point 2.

h3. Expected Results

Condition of point 1 should be able to delete/modified.
h3. Actual Results

Unable to delete the condition.
h3. Workaround

Point 1 can be modified/deleted if condition for point 1 is added after condition of point 2.
fields.summary: Can't delete or modify conditions in workflows when Field is selected “Assignee”

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When you attach a file to a comment in the old view, and that images has the same name as from one existing attachment within the issue, that older attachment will be displayed when you save the comment.

h3. Environment

Jira Cloud.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

* Add an attachment *A* named *an image* to the issue;
* Add an attachment *B* named *an image*  in a comment;
* Save the comment.

See the recording:  [^Adding image to comment.mp4] 

h3. Expected Results

Attachment *B* will be displayed when saving the comment.

h3. Actual Results

Attachment *A* is displayed instead.

h3. Workaround

Edit the comment, changing the reference to attachment *B*.
fields.summary: Adding an attachment whose name is the same as from an existing one will result in the oldest one being displayed

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At this moment, the "Pages" section of Next-gen project will only search for a Confluence instance on the same Cloud URL (for example, the Jira and Confluence softwares are under "instance_a.atlassian.net").

However, if Confluence is at a different Cloud URL ("instance_b.atlassian.net", for example), the "Pages" section will suggest the start of a trial of Confluence on the same cloud URL as Jira.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow the "Pages" section to be able to leverage other Confluence instances.

h3. Why this is important
This should extend the awesome "Pages" feature on Next-gen projects.

h3. Workaround 
At this moment, there is none.
fields.summary: As a Jira admin, I'd like the "pages" section of Next-gen projects to leverage other linked Confluence instances

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Under /secure/admin/ViewPriorities.jspa# we have a field named as *Priority Color* when creating a new priority. 
This field has a button that allows users to select the intended color to use. Yet, it also allows users to input any String to it. 

The problem is if the String inserted is not a color hash, it breaks board views if their card colors are based on *Priorities*.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access /secure/admin/ViewPriorities.jspa# 
 # Add a new Priority and instead of selecting a color for the field *Priority Color*, type the name of the color e.g.: Yellow.
 # Add the priority
 # Access any board
 # Access the board settings
 # Click on *Card colors* on the board settings menu 
 # Make the field "Colors based on" field as *Priorities*

h3. Expected Results
When inserting the priority color, there should be a validation if the input is a valid color hash string and if not, it shouldn't allow the user to save it.

h3. Actual Results
System allows any String to be input in the priority color field leading to problems such as the one described on the "Steps to Reproduce" section.

I've reproduced it with the String "Purple" and the error that is triggered in the board settings page is the following: 
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

You might as well see an error on the board itself stating "Failed to execute search" error." and not allowing you to see the board content at all.

h3. Workaround
The workaround is pretty much the fix of editing the priority color of the "broken" priority by selecting the proper color using the UI instead of manually typing the String.
fields.summary: Priorities’ color field should validate input

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When using the *date picker* feature (calendar icon), the date is formatted incorrectly if language used is Danish.

When using Danish as the profile language, Jira expects months to be formatted with a *period* character right next to it, but the date picker feature *does not* automatically include this character, forcing users to manually insert it. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Update your profile language to be Danish
 # Click the *+* button to create a new issue
 # Use the date picker feature to set a value for a date field (i.e. Due Date)
 # Click Create

h3. Expected Results
Issue creation works as expected

h3. Actual Results
An error saying that the date is formatted incorrectly is returned.
*  !Screen Shot 2019-10-03 at 12.41.18 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
In Danish, the expected format references months with a *period* character at the end (e.g. jan. for January)

Manually including a (*.*) character next to the month allows you to proceed with the issue creation.
fields.summary: Date Picker feature pulls date in unsupported format if language is set to Danish

fields.description:
User(s) is looking for issue list reordering in NextGen project backlog similar to Classic project backlog by drag n drop.

Move to Top of the backlog/Bottom of the backlog is the only available option at the moment.
fields.summary: Allow backlog issues list re-ordering in NextGen project

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If a user with a generic domain (such as @yahoo.com, @outlook.com, etc) access Atlassian Home > People section they can see other users even though they have not collaborated with them.

As mentioned in the feedback documentation, when viewing the People directory, you will see a blend of two sets of users:
 * All other users on the site who's email domain match yours. This excludes a set of known email public email domains like Gmail.
 * The last 30 users you have collaborated with, based on 90 days of activity. Collaboration is defined here as any non-view event (e.g. creating, editing, commenting, liking, watching) on any of the same content.
 * [Call for feedback - Atlassian cloud people directory|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Teamwork-discussions/Call-for-feedback-Atlassian-cloud-people-directory-user/td-p/797370]

h3. Environment
 * Jira Cloud
 * Atlassian Home

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # create a test user with application access, but no access to projects, and not added to any of default groups
 # using the incognito mode, log in as this newly created user
 # access the Atlassian Home by clicking the hamburger (app switch) menu - link [https://instance.atlassian.net/home/people]

h3. Expected Results
 * The user should not see other users

h3. Actual Results
 * the user will see every other user in the instance

h3. Workaround
 * Remove the group the user is a member of from the browse users and groups permission
fields.summary: Atlassian Home People Directory show user information when there is no collaboration

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Administrators do not have access to restrict access to the People directory page
h3. Suggested Solution

Add the functionality to restrict access to the People directory page
h3. Why this is important

As an admin, I would like to control the disclosure of companies/clients that we are working within our Jira instance.
h3. Workaround 

Admins can restrict the "browse" features of the profiles by restricting the "browse users" permissions. See [managing global permissions on CAC|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver070/managing-global-permissions-749382914.html] to learn about modifying this permission.

So basically you need to restrict the browse users in Jira to only certain groups. However, there would be some limitations which include:
 * Top left 'home' button in global nav does nothing.
 * No search.
 * No 'Works with' section.
 * No 'People' in the app switcher
 * Cannot invite users to teams
 * No mentioning of users

[Call for feedback - Atlassian cloud people directory|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Teamwork-discussions/Call-for-feedback-Atlassian-cloud-people-directory-user/td-p/797370]
fields.summary: Ability to restrict access to the People Directory page

fields.description: Currently an internal reporter does not receive email notifications for internal comments due to the option to withhold this information from customer reporters. This would be a nice addition to be able to receive internal comment notifications if you are an internal reporter in future iterations of JIRA.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The focus in the search field is lost after page is completely loaded

# Start typing in eg: "impact" while the page is still loading

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Jira Cloud*. Using *Jira Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-70042].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Currently when trying to search JQL and using the [project field|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/advanced-searching-fields-reference-764478339.html#Advancedsearching-fieldsreference-ProjectProject], the only supported operators are 
bq. = , !=, IS , IS NOT, IN , NOT IN

It does not currently support the use of the WAS or WAS NOT operators.

h3. Why this would be helpful
Extending tracking to an issue's project history here would be very useful in order to try to search for issues that were not initially created in the current project, but rather were moved from another project.  Right now, JQL does not have a native way to search for issues that have been moved from another project.


h3. Workaround
It seems to be something that 3rd party plugins have tried to solve, such as described in https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-questions/View-issues-that-have-been-moved-from-one-project-to-another/qaq-p/790346
However to have Jira be able to do this natively would be preferred.
fields.summary: Add support for the WAS operator to project field when JQL searching

fields.description:

it is obvious that the same item may be necessary for a few different projects spanning features. 

There is nothing to logically  put this together

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In the new Jira issue view, the *Date time picker* Custom field takes into account the timezone of the user updating the field which results in inconsistent values when looking at the Issue History.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# After creating a *Date time picker* Custom field, update the field on an Issue
# Go to your *Personal Settings (https://host.atlassian.net/secure/ViewPersonalSettings.jspa) and change your timezone
# Go back to the same Issue and update the *Date time picker* to a new time

h3. Expected Results

We would expect Jira to display a consistent time coherent to the previous time used.
15/Oct/19 3:30 => 15/Oct/19 6:00
15/Oct/19 6:00 => 15/Oct/19 8:30


h3. Actual Results

It ignores the previous times and updates the time value en coherence with the user's timezone which gives an output as if the time has been changed from what it originally was.

15/Oct/19 3:30 => 15/Oct/19 6:00
15/Oct/19 15:00 => 15/Oct/19 8:30

 !_SCRUM-486__REST_ye_merry_gentlemen__-_JIRA.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes

In the old issue view, regardless of the different timezones from different users that update the field, Jira uses one consistent timezone.

This is in relation to JRACLOUD-34474.

h3. Workaround
No known workaround. To get an accurate view of the time, you can switch to the old issue view.
fields.summary: Date time picker field shows time based on user timezone in new issue view

fields.description:
Hi there,

I have been to the Atlassian Open conference, and it was really great. I very much liked the idea of the team playbook and would like to give it a go.

However, I think it can't work for us. We are a very large team of about 25 and work on multiple projects simultaneously, so most of the time people work on more than 1 project at the time or team members are shuffled between projects, depending on priority changes.

Don't get me wrong, we are extremely agile and practice continuous deployments that way, with deployment schedules driven by the dev team rather than product owners or stake holders, it's really cutting edge.

This is where the problem lies. The 'Project team' for Atlassian Team Playbook is all focused around projects, rather than the actual team or the product. I think that is a key value that's really missing from this new tool.

Thanks for reading and considering. Happy to assist in more detail on how our team operates.

Carolina

 

PS: There was no option in the drop-down for Team Playbook, so I dropped this under Jira Cloud.
fields.summary: Atlassian Team Playbook need to have a different focus

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Intermittently we have Jira users that have enough permissions and privileges throw unexpected error message below when trying to use a Jira user picker (e.g. assignee)
{code:java}
User xxx was not found in the system
{code}
h3. Environment

Only some instances are impacted and this ocurs only on Old Issue View that have a profile related feature applied.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Login to Jira then access any issue and access any Jira User Picker field. 
 # Type in Full Name at User Picker and pressing enter.
 # On purpose the drop down list value was not selected.

 
h3. Expected Results

User can be picked and issue can be saved correctly

*Logs -* User value is passed correctly when selected from the dropdown item, it updates to
{noformat}
<input type="hidden" id="hidden-customfield_10028" name="customfield_10028" value="123xxxxxxAAIDxxxxxxxxxx123">

{noformat}
h3. Actual Results

Error is thrown as above and the assumption is that user cannot be picked as value for the field

As the Full name for example type “Firstname Lastname” into the field, it will look like
{noformat}
<input type="hidden" id="hidden-customfield_10028" name="customfield_10028" value="Firstname Lastname">
 {noformat}
h3. Notes

NA
h3. Workaround

Select the correct user from the dropdown list using the mouse, instead of directly hitting enter
fields.summary: Picking a user results in "User not found in the system" error

fields.description:
{panel:title=Status Update 19 May 2021 - 20:00 UT|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ff7f7f|titleBGColor=#ff7f7f|bgColor=#e5e5e5}
Hi all, based on your feedbacks from our first release, our team realized that we have accidentally taken away some important use cases, as part of our intend to standardize a “true sort” between comments and other tabs. Thus, we’ve made additional changes to the “comment section” which will be rolled out in the upcoming days. The Atlassian team would like to thank you again for the patience and apologies again for the frustration and inconvenience such delay has caused.

TLDR: the comment section should largely resemble display/collapse behaviour in the old issue view which is “latest 5 comments always shown” and “oldest comments always collapsed/hidden”.
 * This means when you select “oldest first” instead of displaying the oldest 5 comments and collapsing most recent ones, you’ll see the most recent 5 comment displayed oldest to newest with the older comments always collapsed. The reason for this change is because (1) we found having oldest comments always displayed isn’t useful for majority of our users (2) many users value/miss the ability to quickly/efficiently navigate to the latest comment in the same vertical space (i.e. bottom of the page) regardless of which issue they’re looking at

 * When you select “newest first” the behaviour stays how it is today. In particular, the “add comment” field will always sticked above the comments, to make sure the latest comment is always close/in-view while you type in new comments, regardless of your sort order. This is different than in the old view, which when sorted “newest first” the comment box would stick to the bottom of the page, further away from the latest comment

 * In addition, we’ve also made it more efficient by reducing the number of clicks needed to switch sort order, by changing it to a button rather than a drop down. 

Meanwhile, the “worklog” and “history” view display will stay as it is today.
{panel}
 
{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 14 October 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#2684ff|titleBGColor=#2684ff|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone, thank you for your interest surrounding this ticket. Before we begin [transitioning all users to the new issue view|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-articles/Transitioning-all-Jira-Cloud-users-to-the-new-issue-view/ba-p/1494104] on 31 March, 2021, we’ll be solving this problem. Watch this ticket for updates as we progress and please add a comment for any questions you may have.
{panel}
h3. Problem Definition

In the old issue view, it was possible to order/re-order the following issue tabs:
 * History
 * Work log
 * Transition
 * Comments

h3. Suggested Solution
 * Allow users to toggle between viewing these tabs/sections using ascending or descending order

h3. Why this is important
 * Some users prefer an ascending list - or the option to toggle between the different ordering(newest to oldest vs. oldest to newest)

h3. Workaround
 * No known workarounds
fields.summary: Ability to reorder comments, issue history, work logs and transition by asc/desc

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When uploading a large attachment via comments and pressing save button multiple times, you will get multiple comments on the attachments.

!image-2019-09-30-22-40-05-241.png|thumbnail! 

!image-2019-09-30-22-40-58-073.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Upload a huge attachment via the comment field.
 # Spam the save button.

h3. Expected Results

On attachment upload, the save button should be grayed out until the attachment upload is done.

h3. Actual Results

Save button is not grayed out and it is possible to click it multiple times; leading to multiple comments being generated on attachment upload completion.

h3. Workaround

Don't click on the save button more than once during attachment upload or only click on the save button once the upload is done.
fields.summary: Comments are posted multiple times if 'Save' is clicked multiple times during the attachment upload duration.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Uploading an image between lines of text may fail if you do not wait for its full upload in the file picker.

h3. Environment

Jira Cloud.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

* Type a line of text -> press enter;
* Type another line of text -> go up to the previous line -> press enter;
* Upload an image -> when selecting a file in the file picker, click on *Insert file* before the image is fully uploaded (you can see a progress bar on the file);
* When the image's upload is completed (in the Comment field), click on *Save*.

Here's a recording of the problem, as well as from the cases where it will work properly:   [^Image upload in new issue view.mp4] 

h3. Expected Results

The comment will be saved.

h3. Actual Results

Nothing happens when you click on the *Save* button.

h3. Workaround

When you wait for the full upload of the file in the file picker before clicking on *Insert file*, it works correctly.

Also, if you can cancel the current comment, when trying again, the file will already be in the recent uploads. Selecting the file from there will work properly as well.
fields.summary: Images fail to be uploaded in a comment in the new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When doing a Jira Site import from a Server backup file, the import fails with a validation error
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Take a backup of a Jira Server instance
 # Perform a System Restore using this backup file
 # Select the option to *Merge with existing cloud users* in the section about 'Choose what to do with imported user data'

h3. Expected Results

Server import will complete and user data will be merged into existing Cloud user base
h3. Actual Results

A validation error is thrown:
{noformat}
Could not merge users with existing ones since it exceeds license count
{noformat}
 

!image-2019-09-30-14-09-57-232.png|width=450,height=151!
h3. Workaround

You can remove users and from the backup file before importing to avoid this error and contact Atlassian support to import users manually
* MacOS:
{code:java}
$ sed -i '' '/<User id="/d' entities.xml
$ sed -i '' '/<Membership id="/d' entities.xml
{code}
* Linux:
{code:java}
$ sed -i '/<User id="/d' entities.xml
$ sed -i '/<Membership id="/d' entities.xml
{code}
fields.summary: Could not merge users with existing ones since it exceeds license count

According to  [Exporting test sessions for JIRA Capture|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-questions/Exporting-test-sessions-for-JIRA-Capture/qaq-p/281404] there wasn't an out of the box way to backup test session from Jira Captures and the default XML backup from Jira doesn't include those information.

It would be a nice to have a feature to backup those data from Jira site backup.
fields.summary: Ability to backup test session for Capture of Jira

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Consider that you have attachments on the description field of an issue. After you clone this issue, the file will fail to load in the New Jira issue view, but will show properly while using the old issue view.

The following video better demonstrates this behaviour:

 [^JRACLOUD-73067.mp4] 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access an issue which has an attachment on its description;
 # Clone the issue, also cloning the attachment.

h3. Expected Results
When you access the cloned issue, the attachments in the description are available

h3. Actual Results
When you access the cloned issue, while using the New Jira issue view, the attachment will fail to load. Clicking "retry" doesn't solve the problem.

h3. Workaround
Users can disable the New Jira issue view for now, on a per-profile basis. To achieve this:

# Click the profile icon, on the bottom of your left sidebar, then *Settings* under "JIRA";
# On the "Jira Labs" section, click to disable the *New Jira issue view*.
fields.summary: After cloning an issue which has a file on its description, the attachment will fail to load in the New Jira issue view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Using the Workflow Advance function to set a transition that create a Post-function to "Update issue custom field" and *Append* a value for multi-line custom text field, doesn't work.
 
h3. Environment
Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to *Jira Settings > Issues > Workflows*
 # Click on the Workflow, go to a Transition and "Add a Post-function"
# Select the "Update issue custom field" option
# Choose a Custom field that was created using the multi-line text field
# Add a value such as '%%CURRENT_DATETIME%%'
# tick the "Append" checkbox and update the Post-Function -> Publish your workflow to save changes.
 !post-function.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
* The value should be appended once the transition is passed.

h3. Actual Results
* The New Value is set, rather than appended.

h3. Workaround
For some reason, adding this "*\n*" with a 1 <space> character then the intended text actually appends the value but it still shows this "*\n*" character as part of the text. This way the new line is actually added to the value field. e.g. "*\n %%CURRENT_DATETIME%%*"

h3. Note
* (!) Also note, that due to using this \n, and then using functions such as %%CURRENT_DATETIME%% doesn't  render the current date anymore.
fields.summary: Post-Function "Update issue custom field" doesn't render <new line> using Append

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

*NOTE*: It only occurs for the first swimlane and the second swimlane onwards it works as expected.

h3. Expected Results
The Agile Wallboard Gadget should show all the swimlanes even if they are collapsed. 

h3. Actual Results
The Agile Wallboard Gadget does not show the first swimlane if it is collapsed. 

h3. Workaround
No Workaround
fields.summary: Agile Wallboard Gadget does not show the first swimlane based on Assignee and Projects if the swimlane is closed in the board

fields.description:
h3. Description
When running JQL searches, it is possible to search for specific words in fields, as exemplified below:
* *{{comment ~"Teamwork"}}*

Searches, however, only consider *one single comment* at a time, which makes it not possible to search for issues that have *specific words in different comments*, as shown below.
* *{{comment ~"These" and comment ~"Comments" and comment ~"Exist"}}*
** This would return an issue that contained *one comment* with *all three words*, but not an issue with *all three words* in *different comments*

h3. Suggestion
It would be good if Jira was capable of performing searches in multiple comments, so that users could search for issues that had specific words, not necessarily together. This would enhance Jira's search capabilities, allowing users to find specific issues more easily.
fields.summary: JQL should allow users to search for words in multiple comments

fields.description:
On the new UI, we have the option to do to user's profile and we need to click on some options until we get the desired one.

Previously on the old UI, we had the option to see the activity, profile, current issues (open issues where the user is the assignee) and for admins, the option to administer user.

!Screenshot 2019-09-26_17-13-45-006.png!

For the new UI, we can see tickets that the user worked on, but the view has very limited information and it does not filter only tickets where is user is the assignee.

It would be great if we had the same options as before because is much faster to find the desired information.
fields.summary: Add back shortcuts to see user's details on the new UI

fields.description:

Sometimes we wish to confirm the details of the email that was sent, like the TO or even the subject.

It would be great if we had an option in the UI to see the history or an audit log of all the emails that an admin sent.
fields.summary: Ability to see email history from Send Email option

fields.description:
h3.Summary

Currently, issue linking do not support URLs. To link an issue, you need to first time in the number or issue key. JIRA will then suggest a ticket based on issue key.  However if you try copy pasting the URL with the issue key, JIRA will not be able to process the input. 

Will be convenient if JIRA is capable of directly transforming JIRA URLs into tickets.
fields.summary: Issue linking should take in consideration of URLs not just issue keys

fields.summary: Add Customers to Organizations from Customer Search Results

fields.description:
As a user creating USs I want a non-confusing interface when I use a pop-up blocker so I don't loos the information I just typed in the new US pop-up dialog.

*Reproduce*

Chrome + adblock+ Jira v7.12.3 (standard configuration at client site)

This situation prevents Jira from creating pop-ups. Upon clicking the Create button in the top of the window it seems that Jira detects this somehow and shows another kind of pop-up. But the situation with and without adblock has a subtle difference:
 # without pop-up block the new-user-story window is modal. Also the Create button at the top of the screen is disabled.
 # with pop-up block the new-user-story window is *almost* modal: the create button at the top is enabled.

In the situation with pop-up blocker the create button looks like the create button at the bottom and users can be confused and use the top button when they want to commit their changes. But the button at the top will always display a new and empty pop-up, where the user looses the just entered information.

Some more remarks:
 # Upon clicking the upper Create button twice there are actually multiple popups created, overlaying each other. The user did actually not loose any information and just needed to close the accidental duplicate overlaying popup.
 # the button Create is displayed twice. There might be UI design rules about this but the confusion might be less big if the buttons had different names.
fields.summary: Clicking 'create' button twice creates confusing situation

fields.description:
Currently, there's no way to adjust the image alignment from the new issue view. When an image is embedded in the new issue view, it always appears from the center and taking a lot white space in between the text.

It would be beneficial to our customer if we have a feature to change the image alignment from new issue view.
fields.summary: Ability to adjust image alignment on the new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

While using workflows and Advanced configuration, you might want to add validators to prompt on screen when some value is not entered. Therefore using the "Field Required Validator" and ensuring that some fields are required doesn't prompt for error when doing bulk issue transition.
h3. Environment

Jira Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Project with some issues on it.
 # Go to the workflow *Project Settings > Workflow*
 # Edit it and add a Validator to a Transition with some fields that would be required.
 # Add a Screen as well and populate it with those fields. ((!) this is not necessarily essential)
 # Navigate to the issue Navigator Search, use a JQL to search out issues in a particular status e.g. "To Do"
{code:java}
 project = AT2 AND type = Sub-task AND Status = "To Do" {code}

 # Bulk changes these results into another Status e.g. "In Progress" or "Done"
 !bulk.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results

The bulk transition, should prompt and mention that, since there's a validator in place, the bulk transition will not be changed. The "Next" button should then be disabled.
h3. Actual Results

There is no error message, even though values are entered on the fields that are required or not. The Status is not changed from "To do" to "In Progress".
h3. Notes

There's no error on screen. an error limiting the user or prompting the user that no changes will be done and subsequently disable the button from proceeding to the next stage should be the expected outcome.
h3. Workaround
 * If you want to continue with Bulk transition, remove the *validator* from Transition workflow in order to proceed.
 * Adding a Loop around the Status with the "Allow all statuses to transition to this one" would suffice on the Status you're attempting to transition the issues to.
fields.summary: Bulk transition doesn't show error when a validator is used on the workflow

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If you create a bulleted list and use the delete key to delete from above the list or above a bulleted item, the whole bullet and all content under the bullet is deleted with it.
Example video here:
 [^delete bullet bug.mov] 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a bulleted list
 # Under one of the bullets (the first bullet is easiest) add a nested bulleted list.
 # place the text cursor on the end of the line immediately above the bullet with the nested list
 # Hit the delete key the required number of times in an attempt to bring up the text from the bullet. (usually twice)

h3. Expected Results
- The bullet is removed and absorbed into the line above.

h3. Actual Results
- the bullet and all content is deleted including any nested bulleted lists.

h3. Workaround

Use backspace instead of delete to get the desired text locations.
fields.summary: Deleting from above/before a bulleted item deletes the bullet and all content including any sub-bullet items and their content.

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition
Whenever mouse curser cross a user in user-picker field the user preview modal appears immediately and stays there for awhile, even if the curser moved away. This blocks the visibility for some issue fields that are covered by user preview modal.

*Note*: this occurs in issue page in old issue view.

h3. Suggested resolution
The user preview modal should appear after a delay (e.g 2 second) when the curser is over the user name. Or please implement the ability to disable this popup modal, it's annoying as it immediately appears whenever mouse curser crosses a user name.

fields.description:
Other teams in our company have added several apps that my own team doesn't need. The issue view has become more and more cluttered because of this. To solve this problem, there should be a project setting that allows to deactivate apps for the project so that their widgets are no longer shown in the issue view.

I understand that the new issue view mostly solves this problem. However, I and the other team members prefer the view with the fields on top of the description instead of the side bar.

fields.description:
With the Jira for Outlook app when adding a comment in Show Issues in Outlook, it does not have the ability to @mention a user. This is possible in the plugin as it works for assigning users to issues. Can the user picker functionality be extended to comments as well? Most comments in my team involve tagging users.

Steps to reproduce:
 # Open an email in Outlook containing an excerpt of a Jira Issue
 # Select Show Issues in the Jira Cloud ribbon in Outlook
 # Select the issue in the View Issues tab in the pane
 # Try adding a comment and @mentioning a user
 # Check the comment in Jira and the @mention will be in plain text without the user tagged.

 # View the issue in the classic issue view - doesn't show syntax highlighting

h3. Expected Results
Should not show syntax highlighting on classic or new issue view.

h3. Actual Results

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
JQL searches that include the *issueLinkType* field may not work depending on the amount of issues and links that exist.

h3. Environment
Cloud
- This behavior does not change between the new and old issue view

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Although this problem does not occur *always*, it may happen in instances with a considerably high amount of issues (i.e. 300k+ issues).
# To replicate, run a simple search containing the *issueLinkType* field
#* Example: *{{issueLinkType is not EMPTY}}*

h3. Expected Results
Search returns issues that match search criteria
 
h3. Actual Results
An error saying "An unknown error occurred while trying to perform a search."

A failed request with a response code of "JQL too complex" may be returned in the *Browser's console*

h3. Workaround
Limiting the search criteria may be a valid workaround.
* Example: *{{project = <Project A> and issueLinkType is not EMPTY}}*

In case that search does not work, it is possible to try a different approach:
* Create a filter *filter* like: *issueLinkType is EMPTY*;
* Perform the search like the following: *project = <project> AND filter != "filter"*
fields.summary: Issue searches containing "issueLinkType" may not work depending on the amount of existing links

fields.description:
Atlassian Update
👋 As we believe this is a valid use case, we don't have an immediate solution for it in the new issue view. While we are working with the relevant teams to re-evaluate this sitting and if we will keep supporting this capability, please refer to the workaround which by using the old issue view for now.


----


h3. Summary

Editing a custom date picker does not respect the date/format settings and shows "Sunday" and first day of week despite having the "Look and feel" option set for Monday to be start of week. 

h3. Environment
- New Jira issue view

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Configure a custom date/time format as shown [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/configuring-the-look-and-feel-of-your-jira-applications-780861527.html]
# Navigate to an issue and edit a date picker field > Click on the calendar icon


h3. Expected Results
* Custom date/time formats should display in the date picker field
Appears as custom date format example:  !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
* The format always appears as "yyyy/mm/dd h:mm a" with Sunday as first day of week
Appears as in the New issue view as: !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
Appears in old issue view as: !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 


h3.Workaround

Turn off the new issue view by clicking your avatar(bottom left corner of Jira) > Personal settings. Under "Jira labs" - turn off the toggle switch:
Direct path: https://<instance_name>.atlassian.net/secure/ViewPersonalSettings.jspa
fields.summary: Custom date/time format setting not respected when editting a date picker custom field in New Issue View

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian status as of July 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#b2d4ff|titleBGColor=#b2d4ff|bgColor=#eaf1fc}
Microsoft has not released any major updates for IE11 since 2015, and has [recently discouraged the use of IE11 as a default browser|https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/Windows-IT-Pro-Blog/The-perils-of-using-Internet-Explorer-as-your-default-browser/ba-p/331732].

To allow us to continue to take advantage of modern web standards to deliver improved functionality and the best possible user experience across all of our products, we have ended support for IE11 on *31 March 2020*.

End of support means we will not fix bugs that are specific to IE11, and will begin to introduce features that aren't compatible with this browser.

Find out more about this change from our [announcement|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Feedback-Forum-articles/Retiring-IE11-support-for-Atlassian-cloud-server-and-data-center/ba-p/1185312].

If you have questions or concerns about this change, please comment on this issue.
{panel}
fields.summary: Plans to end support for IE11
